text:
They are *First Bank Puerto Rico :* <https://www.1firstbank.com/pr/es/personal/homepage.html>

Here is the info from TAM:

1. *The number of forms currently in use:* Forms that work as form, connected via API to Drupal or Velocify: About 30 forms. Many are few fields (less than 10). The biggest form is this one (in both languages) - <https://www.1firstbank.com/content/forms/af/simple-forms/long/pr/es/leadform.html> (direct url to form)
2. *URL's to any forms in use:*
    ◦ <https://www.1firstbank.com/content/forms/af/simple-forms/long/pr/es/leadform.html> (direct url to form)
    ◦ <https://www.1firstbank.com/pr/es/formulario-de-captacion.html> (same form but inside site container).
 *3. Are any custom components currently in use?* We have 3 decision form (no fields) that work as a decision tool for the account or credit cards. Those are part of the code we already share. There are 6 of them (3 spanish, 3 english).

    ◦ <https://www.1firstbank.com/content/forms/af/decision-tree/es/dt-saving-es.html> (direct url)
    ◦ <https://www.1firstbank.com/pr/es/personal/cuentas/cuentas-de-cheques.html> (sites page)
<@W4XTCQ07J>, Are they same as First Citizens Bank ?
are they on AMS/CS ?
They have asked update backport of .xdp.html feature on 6.5 and an issue related to font on mac, I am working on later one.
I think we should be creating documents to answer their questions and update them later in our documentation
Any updates on Charles or are we blocked on some POC ?
IMO they can create a custom profile for static forms with param mfDisablePagination
<@W6CBB4953> They mentioned that most of their forms are static..

Caching : The caching was removed as data merge on the client was taking too much time, but that was 2013. The browsers and devices have improved a lot since then. We never tried it after that 
Pagination: we had the support for that, mfDisablePagination but if the content is dynamic based on scripts and data, it will not solve their issue

1. Simplification and Document Management: The primary requirement is the simplification and improved management of documents, which is currently lacking in the desktop designer. This presents an opportunity to emphasize the benefits of transitioning to a cloud-based solution.
2. Feature Satisfaction: They are satisfied with the features of the desktop designer.
3. Labeling Needs: They seek a new labeling solution to replace their current system, <https://www.satoamerica.com/resources/software/label-sofware/nice-label#:~:text=The%20NiceLabel%20designer%20delivers%20a,of%20barcoding%20or%20designer%20training.|NiceLabel>. We can highlight that Desktop Designer already support label creation.
4. Complex Document Workflow: Their current document workflow is complex, and they believe it is not optimised. They are looking for our recommended workflow to streamline their processes.

*Update from Customer*
• During the next 2 weeks, they will evaluate the solution functionally. 
• Post June 2, they will revert.

> Have we looked at logs for PDF preview issue ? Nothing in logs to suggest something ?
The logs do not provide a clear indication of the root cause, displaying only a generic message: *"incorrect Template."* As a result, we have requested either the XDP file or access to their Dev2 environment for further investigation.
During the meeting, we attempted to isolate the issue by removing and re-adding various fragments. The template previewed correctly in those cases, suggesting that this may be a specific scenario.

> Non-IC issue - What is the app framework ?
<@W4RSW3ECC> They have created some page ( it was sample page, we have asked for sample content package) on AEM and theme was not getting updated. They mentioned that 1st time when they add theme it works but update on it is not working for them. We have asked them to create a support team with reproducible steps.

We will start debugging that once we get details from them.

Thanks. Have we looked at logs for PDF preview issue ? Nothing in logs to suggest something ?
Non-IC issue - What is the app framework ?
Thank you Sud.

<@W4R5LUPK3>: Thanks for sharing this - Included the JAVA API doc in the mail thread.

<@U0213T59LMN> NFCU is seeking an update on the same, I have included you in the email, need to share a sample implementation on their usecase
1. Member submits the Form with the data, initial validations of the data for correctness are done
2. After submission, we make a call to generate JWT token using environment specific credentials
3. Using the JWT from step#2, and additional auth parameters, next API call is made including the submitted data to the service provider.
4. Submitted data needs to be reformatted to include API parameters in the body and create a custom JSON object with the data that was submitted.
5. Handle the standard response.
6. All the work needs to happen in the background, not the client browser.
cc: <@W4RU4N66R> <@W4RSW3ECC>

> • *Multiple Signatures:* Check with the team on the foundation forms to confirm if there is an option for multiple signers and report back. (Sudhanshu) - <@W4SG81T9C> could you help confirm if we support updating fields for subsequent signers?
In foundation components based AF, we have Adobe sign block, where authour can specify fields and assign them to subsequent signers. These fields are fileed by the signer at time of signing the agreement.
<@U03MZF7FFEH>, can you extract XDP from first PDF.  Then pass it through Output’s generatePDFOutput API with tagging enabled to produce a tagged PDF.
<@W9QMZFR39> They have added accessibility roles in the XDP

<@W4XTCQ07J>, Output service cannot tag PDFs directly. It works with XDPs (with accessibility roles added for each element) and data to produce a tagged PDF when the tagging option is set to true. We had a heuristic based API to tag flat PDFs. I am not sure if it will work with XFA based PDFs as well? <@U061P671RN1> to confirm. Secondly, the using this API may not result in a fully tag PDF.
The best result would be produced when accessibility roles are defined in the PDF.

FYI - this is for Media & Publishing (M&P) organization - and DMAF is part of it. Emily is not directly engaged with M&P (who did a POC with Sign team) - but we want to promote similar infra for Forms.

<@W9QMZFR39> Need a quick help with the files below shared by IRS. The first one is an XFA file generated by Designer (not a tagged PDF) and the second one is a tagged PDF generated by a third-party. Could you help convert the first one to a tagged PDF using output service - and help confirm if all the required tagging is retained.

Submission Details
1. Simple data entry forms - Email notification 
2. Competition forms - Sitecore database and is exported manually as csv file by database team, who then add users that signed up for marketing into relevant marketing database
3. Customer service forms -- Email Notification
4. Compensation forms - Email & Dynamics 365

From Co-Pilot:
> _Yes – your Rapid Development Environment (RDE) can make use of AEM as a Cloud Service’s advanced networking features, as long as it’s part of a non-sandbox program and you have the Admin role._
> _The advanced networking capabilities you can configure for an RDE (and any other non-sandbox environment) are:_
> • _Flexible port egress – allow outbound traffic over non-standard TCP/UDP ports_
> • _Dedicated egress IP address – have all outbound traffic originate from a fixed, unique IP_
> • _Virtual Private Network (VPN) – establish a secure tunnel between your network and AEM as a Cloud Service_
Also, a quick Jira search gave below tickets suggesting Advanced Networking for RDE:
• <https://jira.corp.adobe.com/browse/CSMEOPS-3331>
• <https://jira.corp.adobe.com/browse/SKYOPS-54528>
I dont think RDE support advance networking
RDE can be positioned for quick backend development - though not sure if the team has tried it here

Agree. This was an early pitch for Sales and we can recommend the same once they plan to move ahead. More details from the meeting:
• Their forms had a requirement to generate *Document of Record* (currently not supported in UE) - with scripts in DoR - to show/hide different sections (before form submission) - in fact they do not have a form submission in the 2 forms they requested demo for.
• *Existing support:*
    ◦ They asked about bindRef - especially the *same name binding* - which allows to easily sync 2 fields.
    ◦ They also talked about a requirement for *versioning* and *audit trail.*
    ◦ We highlighted that the DoR could be authored using the *Web Designer*
• They have a requirement for (*currently not supported*):
    ◦ *Charts*:  In runtime (they need it in DoR as well - though not immediate).
    ◦ *Reusable Rules*: They were interested in how the Rules were defined using the visual rule editor. Though their use-case can be met by Fragments (which was an acceptable solution for them).
The 2 forms we demoed:
• <http://no1010042067170.corp.adobe.com:4502/content/forms/af/corebridge/test-form-001.html?wcmmode=disabled>
• <http://no1010042067170.corp.adobe.com:4502/content/forms/af/corebridge/generationstation.html?wcmmode=disabled>
We highlighted some improvements in the new forms created - and shared that *Forms Optimizer* could help identify opportunities to improve the form conversion (with reference to the form).
cc: <@W4RSW3ECC>

Since the UE based forms are almost at a feature parity (as mentioned in the last release demo by <@W4RU4N66R>), shouldn't we be recommending and demoing only that for new (prospective) customers?
cc <@W4RSW3ECC>

Need to look into their form to analyze how big they are ? MF fits all the criteria (except prefill, which if they are not using name bindings, can be solved as well).

How many requests do they handle currently ?  I don’t think MF will scale without caching if they have too many requests. <@WQ6GEBZHN> how are we handling template caching in cloud ?

The approach that we suggested for 4Point may not work with very large forms plus we would be having bad Lighthouse scores (bad LHS is true for MF as well)

Prefill will anyways has to be solved on client  (for Delrina)  but need to check when.
<@W6CBB4953>: Is MF the right choice for this considering large form ?

Just for clarity for USC and FDM azure connector
• we are backporting USC to 66 (65 already done with custom impl support and no default support for azure connector for IRS).
• We are not backporting azure connector - which is default for USC to 65 as its close to EOL. Azure connector and USC with full support be backported to 66.
• For new changes which is custom implementation support for USC, that’ll be ported to master.
cc: <@U0213T59LMN> <@W4R5LUPK3> <@W4RU4N66R>
Ideally we would like to keep parity between 6.5 and 6.6, else it would be difficult to maintain what is missing from 6.6 as compared to 6.5

<@W4R5LUPK3>, <@W4RSW3ECC> - Do we need to backport all the features provided to 6.6? Also, should features like custom USC be included in the Cloud as well?

CC - <@U0213T59LMN>

> Where do we suggest them to raise issues?
Forms Boilerplate -> issues

<@W4RU4N66R>, It is explained here <https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/experience-manager-cloud-service/content/edge-delivery/build-forms/universal-editor/create-custom-component|https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/experience-manager-cloud-service/content/edge-d[…]ry/build-forms/universal-editor/create-custom-component> . Let me know if my understanding is incorrect.

Shall work on its SEO. <@U03QB0GK45Q> is there any feedback for it from customer?
This discovery problem is one of the reasons contributing to TTV (and therefore, diminishing the impact of UE based customisation)
Where do we suggest them to raise issues? Is it documented anywhere to raise such issues.
<@WAM5KDYBZ> :point_up:

> This should be very important as simplified custom component is the primary driver behind UE adoption and lower TTV.
Its not about TTV but discovery problem as we dont have any documentation
<@W4RT1B152>- We suggest them to raise issue in boilerplate for any queries so that it can help in other customers or partners

Their main problem was that they were modifying/taking things out of the product code like `form.js` to tailor to their use case. I had shared the documentation links and ended up walking through the custom component creation process to clear out doubts and they said they'd refactor with the right approach.

Can you pls elaborate on the incorrect approach they are following and what are the issues they faced due to that approach and how can we improve so that no other developers fall in the same pit?
This should be very important as simplified custom component is the primary driver behind UE adoption and lower TTV. 
<@W4RU4N66R>

FYI <@U03SKJ044LV> from LAS team is also involved with this customer
cc: <@W4RU4N66R>

<@U03Q109GQMT> <@WE163TH43> I am in favor of twice/week meeting and addressing issues in offline mode (email is their preferred way). Can you please share these details over email to NFCU team and including me and we can discuss the same.

<@W4RU4N66R> timeout error is not because of the issue we discussed today where table had many rows. Timeout will come when we have many pages in the pdf.
